item.title: Multiple ssh profiles for multiple services
item.description: I use git – quite extensively. At work, we have several git repositories, across different organizations. In addition, I also hack for pleasure. Interacting with several git servers means that I need to have different roles and identities for them. The solution is to setup up one ssh key for each domain, and use ~/.ssh/config profiles to control them. Based on the host I’m connecting to, a different ssh private/public key pair is used – make life a lot easier!
